page.title: 07ATWORTH VILLAGE LIFE
page.content: ENTERTAINMENT_RECREATION Because of the restrictions on new houses due to the sewerage problem,there are few second home owners and commuters,this in spite of the area being considered desirable.This has meant that Atworth has a very strong feeling of identity and retains its village atmosphere. This community feeling is reflected in the flourishing clubs and events that take place in the village.The centre of activity is the Atworth Institute where some of the following clubs meet.18-80 Club,Toddlers group,Playgroup,Beavers Club Youth Club,Womens Fellowship,Ladies Choir,60 Plus Club and St Johns Ambulance Brigade.There is also a Judo dojo with a large membership that competes nationally,with success.
